intro: Phalangium villosum, commonly known as the hairy phalangium, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
